climbs.name: Of Course of Quartz   -----AKA----- Beef Steak  ------AKA------- Marshall's Brand New Hot Tub

content.description: Stand start left of the crack with a foot on the quartz ramp on the hole. Start matched on the low long rail and climb directly up past big confident rails above. At the top trend right a bit top out as per "Mr. Stripey"

This line sit starts low and left of the arete. The line traverses diagonally up and right to join the arete.In the middle of the wall (follow the long low ramp to the right-most end and look up) look for the low jug lobe-ledge just above the low right section of the ramp.To the right of the ramp (7ft left of arete) sit start on two low crimps. Lock off at the start and cross over to the high, diagonal flat rail. Keep working right to the arete and climb direct up the arete to top out.

Locate the one, very obvious vertical crack on the wall.Stand start at the base, right hand to the right of the crack on a side-pull rail, left hand on the small pinch on the left side of the crack. Work up the crack using the crack and holds around it. Top out direct.
content.location: Crack line on the Long Wall

content.description: Great climbing with classic crimpers.Sit start left of "Hanky" and to the right of the crack on the jug lobe thats up and right of the ramp.Reach up off the lobe into crimps and climb up direct. Work through edges, rounded rails and direct to the easy top out.
Directly behind the Hemlock Boulder and slightly touching on one end, the Long Wall hosts a number of excellent boulder problems with a flat landing all across.
